articles.author: Andrew Mills, Nidal Al-Mughrabi, James Mackenzie
articles.description: Israel delayed approval of a deal with Palestinian militant group Hamas for a ceasefire in the Gaza Strip and release of hostages, but the United States said it still expected the agreement to go into effect on Sunday as planned.
articles.title: Israel holds off approving Gaza ceasefire but US says deal is on track

articles.author: Ju-Min Park, Hyunsu Yim, John Geddie
articles.description: As 3,000 riot police swarmed his hillside villa on Wednesday, South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol huddled with party loyalists, telling them that people were increasingly realising the country's legal system had been hijacked by leftist forces.
articles.title: 'It starts now': South Korea's President Yoon defiant as police closed in

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Pakistani court sentenced former Prime Minister Imran Khan to 14 years imprisonment on Friday in a land corruption case, local broadcaster ARY News reported.
articles.title: Pakistan court sentences ex-PM Imran Khan to 14 years in land graft case, ARY News reports

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian air defences downed 33 of 50 drones launched by Russia overnight, the air force said on Friday.
articles.title: Ukraine's air force says it downed 33 Russian drones launched overnight

articles.author: Anthony Deutsch
articles.description: International Criminal Court Prosecutor Karim Khan has defended his decision to bring war crimes allegations against Israel's prime minister, saying Israel had made "no real effort" to investigate the allegations itself.
articles.title: ICC prosecutor sees 'no real effort' by Israel to probe alleged Gaza war crimes

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Three lawyers for the late Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny were found guilty on Friday of belonging to an extremist group by a Russian court and sentenced to between 3 1/2 and 5 1/2 years, the Mediazona news outlet reported.
articles.title: Three Navalny lawyers jailed for belonging to extremist organisation, Mediazona news outlet says

articles.author: Krisztina Fenyo, Krisztina Than
articles.description: When Agnes Darvas was deported from Hungary to Auschwitz in 1944, she escaped being sent straight to the gas chambers with other children largely because her coat had been stolen in the ghetto and her mother had cut off her braids for fear of lice.
articles.title: Hungarian Auschwitz survivor says world has not learned lesson

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Joe Biden, who leaves office next week, announced on Friday that he was commuting the sentences of nearly 2,500 people convicted of non-violent drug offenses, saying he has now issued more individual pardons and commutations than any predecessor.
articles.title: Biden commutes more sentences, this time for 2,500 non-violent drug offenders

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian arrived in Moscow on Friday for talks with Russian President Vladimir Putin and the signing of a strategic partnership treaty between the two countries, Russia's TASS state news agency reported.
articles.title: Iranian president arrives in Moscow for treaty signing with Putin, TASS says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Indonesia needs 100 trillion rupiah ($6.11 billion) in additional budget to expand its free nutritious meals programme to reach about a quarter of its population by year-end, the head of the agency overseeing the programme said on Friday.
articles.title: Indonesia needs $6 billion more in budget to expand free meals programme
